author: wmtan
body:
Since gcc4.9.1 supports std::regex_match, which was not supported by gcc4.8.1, we can now use C++11 std::regex instead of boost::regex in 7_5_X.  This PR simply replaces the use of boost::regex with std::regex four places in the framework where the replacement is trivial and obvious.
There are two other places in the framework where boost::regex is left in place because the code uses boost regex member functions that have no obvious equivalent in C++.
title: Use std::regex instead of boost::regex where feasible in framework
